author: sky.cactus
content:
In American English, the phrasing comes off as passive aggressive.  A more neutral wording might be something like:
> I personally prefer proposal proposal 2 because it has lower complexity than proposal 1, and I think it is important for us (Ethereum Core Developers) to minimize the complexity in consensus critical code because it simplifies new clients, reduces the chance of consensus failure, and minimizes technical debt build up.
This phrasing uses positive tone instead of negative by indicating a preference rather than distaste, and it makes it clear that these are your opinions on the matter, and it provides constructive details on why specifically you think the goal you are targeting is an important one.
